criteria: Understanding of Ancient Greek and Roman Political Thought
Understanding of English and European Political Thinkers (Locke, Montesquieu)
Ability to Analyze and Connect Historical Political Thought to American Democracy
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the influence of ancient Greek and Roman political thought on American democracy.
Shows a limited understanding of the influence of ancient Greek or Roman political thought on American democracy.
Identifies some basic connections between ancient Greek or Roman political ideas and American democracy.
Explains the influence of either ancient Greek or Roman political thought on specific aspects of American democracy with some detail.
Explains the influence of both ancient Greek and Roman political thought on different aspects of American democracy with clear examples.

Provides a comprehensive analysis of the influence of ancient Greek and Roman political thought on the fundamental principles and moral values of American democracy, including specific examples and connections.
Demonstrates no understanding of the influence of English and European political thinkers like Locke and Montesquieu on American democracy.
Shows a limited understanding of the influence of either English or European political thinkers on American democracy.
Identifies some basic connections between the ideas of Locke or Montesquieu and American democracy.
Explains the influence of either Locke or Montesquieu on specific aspects of American democracy with some detail.
Explains the influence of both Locke and Montesquieu on different aspects of American democracy with clear examples.
Provides a comprehensive analysis of the influence of Locke and Montesquieu on the fundamental principles and moral values of American democracy, including specific examples and connections.
Unable to make any connections between historical political thought and American democracy.
Struggles to connect historical political thought to American democracy, with vague or inaccurate connections.
Identifies connections between historical political thought and American democracy but lacks depth in analysis.
Analyzes the connections between historical political thought and specific elements of American democracy, demonstrating a basic understanding.
Demonstrates a strong ability to analyze the connections between historical political thought and American democracy, providing clear and relevant examples.

Provides a sophisticated and insightful analysis of the connections between historical political thought and the core principles of American democracy, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding and critical thinking.
